poem:
"Loophole Lament"

In halls of power where fortunes flow,
a promise whispers, hollow echo.
With loophole tracks worn threadbare, thin,
the playground of the pinstriped kin.
Will Sunak's kin reap sterling showers,
from obscured and ancient towers?
Hope trapped in an iron cage,
read it all on tomorrow's page.
Sadly, we watch, our faces stark,
as wealth dances in the dark.
